byline.contributor: Ben Protess contributed reporting from New York, and Mark Scott from London.

abstract: Federal Trade Commission is investigating complaints that Google unfairly uses its Android mobile operating system to promote popular products like Google Search and Google Maps; action is latest antitrust problem for company.
lead_paragraph: Some mobile application makers have complained to the Justice Department about a Google requirement that they take a bundle of its services if they want any one of them.

headline.main: F.T.C. Is Said to Investigate Claims That Google Used Android to Promote Its Products
headline.print_headline: F.T.C. Said to Be Looking Into Claims Against Google

snippet: Some mobile application makers have complained to the Justice Department about a Google requirement that they take a bundle of its services if they want any one of them.
